oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chancen und Grenzen der Biofumigation für die Bekämpfung pflanzenparasitärer Nematoden
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hallmann, Dr. Johannes
Buck, Holger
Rau, Florian
Daub, Dr. Matthias
Schütze, Dr. Wolfgang
Grosch, Dr. Rita
Schlathölter, Michaela
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Biofumigation is considered a promising nematode control alternative. In vitro tests confirmed the high nematicidal properties of isothiocyanates, the driving compounds of biofumigation. Its potential under temperate climate conditions was tested on a commercial farm. The tested biofumigation treatments reduced population densities of Pratylenchus spp. but had little effect on Meloidogyne hapla. The latter was most likely due to the good status of the tested varieties. To further optimize the biofumigation system non-host crops with high concentration of glucosinolates have to be selected.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hallmann, Dr. Johannes; Buck, Holger; Rau, Florian; Daub, Dr. Matthias; Schütze, Dr. Wolfgang; Grosch, Dr. Rita and Schlathölter, Michaela (2009) Chancen und Grenzen der Biofumigation für die Bekämpfung pflanzenparasitärer Nematoden. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
